case.title: -A=application
case.description: Runs an application. It starts the first (usually HOME) card - the user is not able to choose which card is first. This is a carryover from A5v1.

case.title: -ALLOWDEBUG
case.description: Allow debugging.

case.title: -COMMAND=xbasic_cmd
case.description: Runs the specified Xbasic commands after Alpha Anywhere starts.
case.note: If you use this option to define a variable, it will not be available until after any AUTOEXEC script runs.

case.title: -CONFIGFILE
case.description: Load command line options from file.

case.title: -EXECUTEANDEXIT
case.description: Shuts down Alpha Anywhere after the command executes. This switch allows you to call existing scripts without having to modify these scripts and add a command to close Alpha Anywhere at the end of the script.
case.note: The command will execute before the Control Panel has loaded. Therefore, you need to fully qualify table names in scripts (e.g. table.open("c:\data\customer") because the Control Panel will not be available to resolve short names.

case.title: -EXEPATH
case.description: Override the Alpha Anywhere exe_path.

case.title: -FULLSCREEN
case.description: Size the Alpha Anywhere window to cover the entire screen.

case.title: -HELP or -?
case.description: Display the command line options.

case.title: -HIDE
case.description: Starts Alpha Anywhere and immediately hides it.

case.title: -ICON=i con_name
case.description: Change the icon that displays on Alpha Anywhere title bar.

case.title: -INCLUDE=filename
case.description: When you have more command line options than can fit on one line, you can create an ASCII file with the command line options in the file. Put one option per line. Use this option to specify the name of the ASCII file.

case.title: -LOG
case.description: Logs addin commands to a file.

case.title: -MAXIMIZE
case.description: Start Alpha Anywhere maximized

case.title: -MINIMIZE
case.description: Start Alpha Anywhere minimized

case.title: -NOASSOC
case.description: Tells Alpha Anywhere not to register Alpha Anywhere file types. This command is only useful if the user does not have permission to write in the registry, which is not recommended.

case.title: -NODBCHECK
case.description: Reduces CPU usage by turning off the periodic checking to see if the database (.ADB) file has changed. This improves performance, especially if you are running lots of copies of Alpha Anywhere on one machine. If you are not adding layouts to a database, you can safely set this flag. (i.e. use this on an end user's installation - which gets updates infrequently, but not on your development system where you are often adding forms, browses, reports, scripts, etc.)

case.title: -NODEBUG
case.description: Turns off the Xbasic Debugger. If you do not debug, the Xbasic script is just hogging extra memory and clock cycles.

case.title: -NOFLOW
case.description: Disable the flow thread (affects legacy asynchronous code).

case.title: -NOMINMAX
case.description: Disable ability to minimize or maximize the Alpha Anywhere main window

case.title: -NOSPLASH
case.description: Do not display a splash screen when Alpha Anywhere loads.

case.title: -NOSIZE
case.description: Disable ability to resize the Alpha Anywhere main window.

case.title: -NOSYSMENU
case.description: Open Alpha Anywhere without a system menu on the main Alpha Anywhere window.

case.title: -PROCESSOR=cpu_index
case.description: When running on a multi-processor computer, selects the primary processor for Alpha Anywhere. This aplies to mulitple physical processors, multiple cores and mulitple virtual processors (Hyper-Threading CPUs). cpu_index is zero-based. If the specified cpu_index is higher than the number of processors available on the system, it is ignored.

case.title: -SINGLESTEP
case.description: Single step through loading of addins.

case.title: -SPLASH=bitmap_name
case.description: Change the splash screen bitmap that displays when Alpha Anywhere loads.

case.title: -TITLE=title"
case.description: Change the displayed title for the main Alpha Anywhere window.

section.title: Notes
section.description: For the command line parameters that take an argument (e.g. TITLE, SPLASH, ICON etc.) you must be sure not to include a space either before or after the " = " sign. For example:

Although you can start the line with just "Alpha5.exe " (or even just Alpha5 ), the system must be able to find the program. If the directory that contains the Alpha5.exe program is not included in the list of directories to be searched when starting a program, then you must include the full path name of the program. For example:

The recommendation is to be safe and always include the full path. The default for the " -icon ", " -splash ", and " -include " options is the Alpha Anywhere program directory. If any of these items are in another directory, they will also require the full path name. Any path name that includes blank spaces must be enclosed in quotes. When there are no spaces, quotes are optional. This is a Windows issue; not an Alpha Anywhere issue. (Note the space between Program and Files in the example below.)
